step.tip: We use Setters to set hundreds of blocks, like magic!
Click and drag the Set Floor block into the workspace
Now we need Numbers for the floor's length and width
Click inside the block and type 10. This tells the Setter to make a floor 10 blocks long
Now we need a Number for width
Click inside the block and type 10
To choose our floor type, we need a Getter
It's diamond time! Select diamond from the dropdown
Click Make to build your world and run the code
素晴らしい！じゃあ、コードで他にもたくさんのブロックを作ろう。Settersを選択しよう。
Let's use Numbers to choose where the blocks will appear
Set y to 15, so the blocks will appear 15 above you
Now we need a number for width (x), height (y) and length (z) of our block. Click on Numbers
Let's get a material for our blocks. Click on the Getters
Yes! Click Make to bring your program to life
Add an x-y-z blocks for your tunnel's position
Add an x-y-z block for the tunnel's size
Pick Stone from the dropdown. This will make the tunnel sides.
Now let's set some air to make a tunnel. Click Setters
Connect it to the bottom of your first Set blocks function
Add an x-y-z block for the air block's position
Set the x to 2 so it will go through the stone block.
Add an x-y-z block for the size of the air blocks
Time to build a home! Go to Setters
Now we need to make a window. Click Setters
Now we need a Number for the window's size
Finally, let's choose a material to use. Go to Getters.
Now we just need to make some air space inside! Click Setters
Connect it to the bottom of your program
Grab an x-y-z block for the air's position
Volcano = tower + lava. First, make the tower. Go to Setters
Grab Set blocks and add it to the workspace
We'll need a Number for its position
Grab an x-y-z block for the volcano size
Now we need a Getter for the tower's material
Now let's grab a Setter for some lava!
Grab an x-y-z block for the lava's position
We want it to appear at the top of the tower. Set the x to 1
Set the y to 11, one block above the top of the tower
Add an x-y-z block for the size
We want to make a block of lava, which will start to flow. Set x to 1
You can make Minecraft type messages with code! Click on Actions
Grab postToChat and drag it into the workspace
Type a message in between the speech marks
Now let's use a function to teleport! Click on Setters
Grab the Set Player Position block. This moves your player anywhere on the map!
In Minecraft, positions in the world are controlled by Numbers
Grab the x-y-z block. X is for sideways, Y is up and down, Z is for front + back
Plug into the Set Player Position block, so they can work together
To fly up in the sky, set y to 50
Combine blocks + teleport to make a sky jail! Click Setters
We need Numbers for the jail's position
Set y to 40 to put the jail in the sky
Grab an x-y-z block for the jail's size
Now let's grab a Setter to create jail's insides
Connect it under your Set blocks function
We'll need a Number for it's position
It's time to teleport! Click on Setters
Connect it under your Set blocks function
Plug into the Set Player Position block
Building farms is boring - make them faster with code! Go to Setters
Add an x-y-z block for the farm's size
Pick Fence from the dropdown. This will make the farm's sides.
Now let's plant some flowers! Click Setters
Connect it to the bottom of your first Set blocks function
Add an x-y-z block for the size of the flower bed
You're becoming a master. Now let's make a fierce, fiery lava trail. We'll use Loops
Grab the While block. Code inside a While keeps repeating as long as the While condition is true.
Change while in the drop down to until. Now the code will keep repeating Until something happens.
We want the Until to wait a bit before setting it again. For this we need an Action
Grab a Sleep block. This simply tells the program to wait.
Set the sleep time to 3. Each time lava is set, the program will wait 3 seconds before doing it again.
Let it go and freeze the world! Click Loops
Now we need to set up our Sleep (waiting time). Click Actions
Plug it inside the do of the loop
Click and set the sleep time to 0.2
Now we need Logic to figure out if you're touching grass
Now we want to check if the block next to you is the water type. Click Logic.
Plug it into the If as the condition.
Now we need a Getter that detects the block that's under our feet
Grab Get Block, which checks the type of block you're standing on
Plug it into the left side of the condition.
Now we need a type to compare it to. Click Getters.
Plug it into the right side of the condition
Select Water from the drop down. Now the conditional will be activated if you're standing on water.
If so, we want to set this block to ice. Go to Setters.
Grab the trusty Set Blocks block
Plug it in as the 'do' of your conditional.
As usual, we'll need Numbers for size and position
Plug it into Position. Remember that 0-0-0 will make a block where you're standing.
Plug it into Size. Remember that 0-0-0 will make a single block.
Now let's choose our material with Getters
Choose Ice from the drop down
It's time for a big splash - a water slide! Click on Setters
We'll need a repeat. Click on Loops
Now put your variable as the x in your x-y-z block
This time, put the variable as the y in your x-y-z block
Connect it inside the x var block
Connect it to the bottom of the repeat block
